lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau Anyk rogI Awvq hYN bYd giiH jYso jYso rog qYso AauKDu KuvwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Anayk Rogee Aavat Hain Baid Grihi , Jaiso Jaiso Rog Taiso Aoukhadhu Khuvaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as several patients come to the house of a medical practitioner, and he administers medicine to each one of them according to their ailment.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwj d√çwr log Awvq syvw nimq joeI jwhIN jog qYsI tihl bqwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Raaj Dvaar Log Aavat Sayvaa Namita , Joee Jaaheen Jog Taisee Tahil Bataavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as myriad people come to the door of the king to serve him, and each one is told to prefer service that he is capable and fit to do;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dwqw pws jn ArQI Anyk AwvYN joeI joeI jwcY dy dy duKn imtwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Daataa Paas Jan Aradee Anayk Aavain , Joee Joee Jaachai Day Day Doukhan Mitaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as many needy persons come to a kind-hearted donor and he gives them whatever each one asks, thus allaying distress of each one of them.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur srn Awvq hYN Anyk isK jYso jYso Bwau qYsI kwmnw pujwveI ]674]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Saran Aavat Hain Anayk Sikha , Jaiso Jaiso Bhaau Taisee Kaamanaa Pujaavaee ?674?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly many Sikhs come into the refuge of the True Guru, and whatever devotion and love one has in the mind the , True Guru fulfils it accordingly.  (674)
